title.native: ファンタジックチルドレン

description:
A group of enigmatic white-haired children has been spotted at different times and places in Europe for over 500 years. Always with the appearance of 11-year-olds, they behave far more mature than they should be, never grow old, and seem to have supernatural power. What they have been seeking is a girl, and the only clue they have is a picture with a crescent moon. Now, in the year of 2012, an athletic boy named Tohma is about to be involved in this centuries-long mystery.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

title.native: ファンタジックチルドレン
ファンタジックチルドレン

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木史朗_(音楽プロデューサー%29) | [Flying Dog](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/)

The founder of record label [flying DOG](https://anilist.co/studio/464/flying-DOG).

He initially aspired to be a professional mangaka and moved to Tokyo to pursue his dream. In 1971, he joined at Tatsunoko Pro as painter before becoming animator. After leaving the company he went freelance and participated in many works in different roles, ranging from key animator to episode director, before making his proper directorial debut with a short film titled Chicken Man & Red Head, which was a part of the [Robot Carnival](https://anilist.co/anime/2182/) anthology.

Nakamura revolutionized anime in the early '80s with his more realistic, extremely detailed and fluid style of animation. He is one of the few animators who has proven that he can successfully take on almost all of the creative burden on a project, proven in both his Robot Carnival short and episode 4 of [Hakkenden](https://anilist.co/anime/1822/).

His 2001 film, [A Tree of Palme](https://anilist.co/anime/1141/), was an official selection of the Berlin Film Festival.

He initially aspired to be a professional mangaka and moved to Tokyo to pursue his dream. In 1971, he joined at Tatsunoko Pro as painter before becoming animator. After leaving the company he went freelance and participated in many works in different roles, ranging from key animator to episode director, before making his proper directorial debut with a short film titled Chicken Man & Red Head, which was a part of the [Robot Carnival](https://anilist.co/anime/2182/) anthology.

His 2001 film, [A Tree of Palme](https://anilist.co/anime/1141/), was an official selection of the Berlin Film Festival.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaieisha_nizo_y) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nizo_yamamoto/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山本二三)

One of Japan’s leading scenic artists and art directors. Noted for his work as an art director on titles such as [Future Boy Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/302/), [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), [Fantastic Children](https://anilist.co/anime/455/) and [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/).

He was also one fifth of [Princess Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/164/)'s art directors. In 1995, [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/) went to the ancient forests of Yakushima, of Kyushu, an inspiration for the landscape of [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/), and the mountains of Shirakami-Sanchi in northern Honshu for location scouting along with the five art directors and other production staff.

On August 19, 2023, he died of stomach cancer at his home, aged 70.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/遠藤重夫)

Joined Nippon Animation in 1973. After some desk work he got promoted to a producer on [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/)'s directorial debut, [Future Boy Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/302/). Following this he took part in the production of World Masterpiece Theater serials.

He initially aspired to be a professional mangaka and moved to Tokyo to pursue his dream. In 1971, he joined at Tatsunoko Pro as painter before becoming animator. Michio Katou is an animation planner and producer.

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%B5%9C%E4%B9%8B%E6%BE%A4%E4%BC%B8)

Shin Unozawa is a planner and producer.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/本橋浩一)

The founder of [Nippon Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/22/).

Passed away due to cancer on October 26, 2010.
Masakatsu Aida is a sound producer.
